noun.description: The action of binding together again (literal and figurative); the fact of being bound or constrained.
Surgery. The action of ligating a blood vessel or other structure for a second or further time; an instance of this.
Molecular Biology. The action of religating fragments of a nucleic acid molecule; an instance of this.

origin: Early 17th century. Originally from classical Latin religātiōn-, religātiō action of tying up or making fast from religāt-, past participial stem of religāre + -iō; compare -ation. In later use independently from re- + ligation; compare religate.
